section.heading: Nursing assistive personnel; registration or certification required.

para.text: A registration or certification is required for a person seeking to practice as nursing assistive personnel in the District in accordance with the rules issued by the Mayor.
The Mayor shall, pursuant to Chapter 5 of Title 2, issue rules setting forth the standards of education and experience required to qualify as nursing assistive personnel.

The Mayor shall allow for a registration or certification of an applicant who is at least 16 years of age; provided, that the applicant shall have obtained or be enrolled and is actively pursuing a high school diploma or high school equivalency diploma as that term is defined in § 4-205.61(6).

The Mayor shall, pursuant to subchapter I of Chapter 5 of Title 2, issue rules setting forth the standards of education and experience required to qualify as a certified nurse aide, which shall include:
Combining the registration or certification process for nurse aides and home-health aides into one profession, which shall bear the title of certified nurse aide;

Establishing a transition process to ensure a person registered or certified in the District as a nurse aide or home-health aide before the effective date of this subsection shall be authorized to practice and represent themselves as a certified nurse aide; and

Creating a temporary license that would authorize a person licensed or certified and in good standing as a nurse aide or equivalent in Maryland or Virginia to practice as a certified nurse aide in the District; provided, that within 5 business days of the Board of Nursing receiving a complete application for a temporary license, the Department of Health shall notify the applicant of:
The temporary license being approved; or
The reasons why the application was denied and the necessary steps for approval.

annotations.annotation: as added July 7, 2009, D.C. Law 18-18, § 2(f), 56 DCR 3624
